responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Not particularly, no. In the midst of everything—from the chaos of my adventures to the quieter moments reflecting on lost friends—I've always found that actions speak louder than words. But when it comes to standing up for what's right or pushing for change, I won't hold back. Whether it's innovating at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes or leading my team at the Ministry, I believe in speaking up for those who can't, even if it means stepping out of my comfort zone.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: I guess I've seen enough darkness to know when someone's actions aren't right, but finding fault isn't really what drives me. More than anything, I want to see people treated fairly and do what's necessary to protect my friends and everyone else. Sometimes it means calling out the bad stuff, but I try to focus on doing what's just, rather than pointing fingers. It's the battles we fight together that truly matter.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: When it comes to doing a thorough job, I've always tried to give everything my all, especially when it matters most. Whether it was figuring out puzzles in the Triwizard Tournament or tracking down Horcruxes to take down Voldemort, I've pushed through no matter what. It's about seeing things through until the end, even if it means taking risks. And yeah, sometimes it's tough, especially when there's so much chaos around, but I guess that's where my friends come in—they keep me grounded and focused on what needs to get done.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Sometimes, I feel so alone, even when surrounded by people. It's like there's a shadow hanging over me, a reminder of all I've lost and the battles yet to come. The pain of losing friends like Dobby or the weight of unfulfilled connections with others, like Cho, it doesn't just go away. But through all the sadness and the moments where everything feels so heavy, I hold onto the hope that comes from knowing I have friends who stand by me, even if the road ahead is dark.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: I don't come up with new ideas just for the sake of it, but when it comes to standing up for what's right and making things better, I'll always try something different if it means helping my friends or changing the world for the better. Whether it's transforming the Auror Department or figuring out a way to defend my friends in the heat of battle, I've learned to rely on my instincts and the support of those around me to find solutions that matter.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Not really, I suppose. I've always found it hard to keep things bottled up, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right or protecting my friends. There's been so much chaos and darkness in my life that I've learned to rely on speaking my mind and acting on instinct to get through it all. It's not just about being brave; it's about believing that we can make a difference and that there's always hope for something better.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say that. I've always tried to help others, whether it was teaching young wizards the Bravery Charm or leading the Aurors to fight for what's right. When I look back, there were so many times I wouldn't have made it without my friends believing in me and standing by my side. It's about facing what's scary and doing what needs to be done, even if it means putting yourself on the line. In the end, it's those moments of helping others and seeing them find their own courage that make everything feel worth it.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be careless sometimes. Like when I tried to catch the Golden Snitch for the first time and ended up crashing into the ground because of a Slytherin’s dirty move. Or when Ron and I tricked Lockhart to get away, and we had to come up with a quick lie to explain ourselves to Professor McGonagall. But you know, those moments of carelessness usually lead to something important or help me understand more about what’s going on around me. It’s part of how I learn, even if it means getting into trouble sometimes.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: I've faced some pretty intense situations, so I guess you could say I'm used to dealing with a lot of pressure. It's not that I don't feel stressed—I do—but the people around me and the memories of those who have fought and fallen keep me going. I try to stay focused on what really matters and rely on my friends to get through the toughest times. In the end, it's the hope that we can make a difference that helps me push forward, no matter how daunting things might seem.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Yeah, I've always been curious about lots of different things. From the mysteries hidden within old textbooks to the stories behind the magical artifacts I come across, there's so much to uncover and understand. It's that curiosity that often drives me to find out more, even when it leads me into trouble. But honestly, every new discovery makes this whole magical world feel a bit more real and exciting, and helps me figure out where I fit in.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Yeah, I'd say I've got plenty of energy. There's always so much to do, whether it's facing off against dark wizards or just helping out my friends. Every time I think I might be running low, something happens that gives me another burst of strength. It's not just about keeping going—it's about making sure I'm doing what needs to be done to protect everyone I care about.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: No, I don't start quarrels with others deliberately. But sometimes, the situations I'm caught up in or the things I hear can make me feel compelled to face challenges head-on, even if that means conflict. I've learned that staying true to myself and standing up for what's right, no matter the cost, is more important than avoiding trouble. My friends and I have faced many dangers together, and in those moments, it's hard to keep everything calm, but we always try to work through our differences because we know trust and unity are our greatest strengths.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: I've always tried to do what needs to be done, even when it's tough or scary. Whether it's catching a Snitch under pressure, facing down dangers in the Triwizard Tournament, or leading Aurors to stop dark magic, I've relied on my instincts and the strength of my friends to get through. I might not always have the answers right away, like with summoning a Patronus, but I keep trying because giving up isn't an option. So yeah, I think I can be counted on when it really matters.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely get tense. Facing down dragons, sneaking into the Ministry, battling the darkest wizard out there—there's a lot of pressure and danger involved in what I do. But I've learned that no matter how scared I am, I have to trust my friends and my own instincts to get through it. It's those moments that really test your courage and make you realize what you're fighting for.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: I guess I've had to be pretty quick on my feet over the years, coming up with plans to outsmart some pretty dangerous wizards. But really, it's more about having the right people around me—friends who can think clearly and come up with ideas when things get tough. And yeah, I've learned to think deeper about the impacts of my actions, especially when it comes to leading and protecting others. It's not always about being ingenious; sometimes it's about holding onto hope and doing what's right, even when it feels like everything else is falling apart.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: I guess you could say I do generate enthusiasm, but it's usually tied to the moments that really matter. Like when I first got to Hogwarts and the feast was full of endless food, or when I helped my friends produce their own Patronuses, seeing their courage grow stronger. It's those times, when there's a chance to make things better or when you're surrounded by people who care about you, that the excitement bubbles up inside. But let's not forget, there's also a lot of caution mixed in with it all. After all, it's not just about being excited; it's about facing what comes next with勇气和决心。有时候，这种热情来自于保护我所爱的人的本能，或是为了正义而战的决心。这些都是让我感到兴奋的事情，因为我知道，在这条充满魔法和危险的路上，我并不孤单。

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: I've learned over the years that forgiveness is a powerful kind of magic. It's not always easy, especially when you've been hurt deeply, but it's essential for healing and moving forward. Seeing Draco Malfoy change, and understanding the struggles Scorpius and Albus faced, taught me that no one is beyond redemption or reconciliation. And when it comes to those closest to me, like my friends and family, I try to remember that even the toughest battles can be won with a bit of hope and love.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I've had my share of messy moments, especially with all the things I've been through. But when it comes to the important stuff, like keeping track of Horcruxes or planning missions with Hermione and Ron, I try really hard to stay organized. It's just that sometimes, with everything else going on, the little things can slip through the cracks. And let's face it, with Dobby and Kreacher around, things tend to get a bit chaotic. But at the end of the day, I know what needs to be done and I make sure to keep a clear head about the big picture.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Worry's a constant companion in my world, isn't it? There's always something lurking around the corner, some threat or another that makes my heart pound a bit harder. But with friends by my side, there's also a flicker of hope that helps push back the shadows. It's hard not to let the fear get to you sometimes, especially when there's so much at stake. But I've learned that facing those worries head-on, rather than running away, is what keeps me grounded and gives me the strength to keep moving forward.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say I've got an active imagination. It helped me get through some pretty tough times, like when I was stuck at the Dursleys and used to dream about flying. And it's definitely come in handy in my adventures—like when I had to use that Time-Turner or figure out how to protect my friends. Sometimes, it feels like the only thing keeping the darkness at bay. But it's also about more than just dreaming; it's about what you do with those dreams. They've pushed me to do things I never thought possible, like standing up to people who try to take over the wizarding world or even becoming an Auror. Imagination has been my friend, but action is what really matters.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Not usually, but there are times when it's better to listen than to speak. I've learned that sometimes, the quiet moments can teach you more about yourself and others than anything else. When I'm thinking about what Dumbledore showed me or planning with my friends to take down Voldemort, I find myself pretty quiet, sorting through all that's going on inside. But when it comes to standing up for what's right, or defending my friends, I don't hold back a bit.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Not really, I guess. Growing up, there were too many times when people weren't what they seemed or when my trust was misplaced. But I've also seen that trust can lead to some of the most incredible things, like Dumbledore sharing his deepest secrets or Delphi’s plan showing a glimmer of hope amidst the darkness. It's a fine line, but in the end, I believe that trust is worth fighting for, especially if it means protecting the people who have always stood by me.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: No, I don't tend to be lazy—I've always felt like there's too much at stake to let things slide. Whether it's training for Quidditch, battling dark forces, or even studying for exams, I've pushed through, knowing that my actions can mean the difference between life and death for those around me. That said, I've definitely relied on my instincts and the support of my friends to get me through some of the toughest times. It's not about being perfect; it's about doing what needs to be done, even when it seems impossible.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: I've been through a lot, more than most people my age should ever have to face. There've been times when I felt like giving up, but I've always had friends and mentors who helped me find the strength to keep going. So, I'd say I'm pretty good at staying focused and keeping my head in tough situations, even if I'm not completely immune to getting upset. In the end, it's about pushing through those feelings and doing what needs to be done for the greater good.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: I guess I've had to be inventive at times, but it's usually been out of necessity rather than some natural inclination. When you're thrown into situations that no one should ever have to face, you find ways to adapt, to come up with solutions that aren't always taught in school. It helps to have friends like Ron and Hermione around, though—they're the real inventors. Their cleverness has often been what got me out of tricky spots. And yeah, maybe in leading the Auror Department, I've had to think differently too, to find new ways to keep people safe. It's all about using what you've got, and sometimes that means figuring things out as you go.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: I guess you could say I'm assertive when it comes to standing up for what's right or protecting those I care about. It's not always easy, and sometimes I feel like I'm shouldering more than I can handle, but knowing that my actions can make a difference keeps me going. Whether it's facing down a Dementor or challenging someone who threatens the wizarding world, I try to do what needs to be done, even if it means thinking outside the box or dealing with tough choices.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Cold and aloof? Not really. I've always been drawn towards uncovering the truth and helping those around me, even if it means getting a bit closer to people than they might want at first. There's something about seeing past the surface—like understanding Snape's pain or Hagrid's excitement over Norbert—that makes it hard for me to just shut everyone out. It's not about being brave all the time; it's about doing what needs to be done, even when it's tough. And yeah, sometimes that means making tough decisions, like focusing on the joke shop's success while staying loyal to my friends. But ultimately, my path has been about fighting for what's right and finding strength in the bonds I've made along the way.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Yeah, I do. When there's something important that needs doing, something that matters to me or to my friends, I don't give up. Even if things get tough, I keep going. After all we've been through, I know that quitting isn't an option, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right and protecting the people I care about. That's part of why I became an Auror—to keep fighting against the darkness.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be moody. With everything that's happened and all the stuff I've seen, it's hard not to sometimes. But I try to keep my head up, especially for my friends. They've been through a lot too, and we need to stick together, no matter what. Even when things get dark, there's always a bit of hope that keeps us going.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: I've always found there's a certain beauty in the moments that connect us—the portraits in the Headmaster's office tell stories of bravery and complexity, and seeing the joy on students' faces, whether in the Great Hall or at Quidditch matches, reminds me of the importance of those stories. Even though my path has been filled with challenges and darkness, I've learned to see the light in the connections and bonds we form, which are some of the most powerful forms of magic there are.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Sometimes, yeah, I do feel shy or inhibited. Especially when there's so much going on, so many secrets and dangers. It can be overwhelming, knowing what's at stake and trying to keep my friends safe. But when it comes down to it, when I need to stand up for what's right or protect those I care about, I find the courage. It's not always easy, and I've had my moments of doubt and fear, like watching Neville fall or feeling the pressure of everyone's expectations. But those times also remind me of the support I have, and that helps more than anything.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: I guess you could say I try my best to be kind and considerate. It's hard sometimes, with everything that's happened, but I've learned that showing empathy can make a big difference to people, whether they're close friends or someone I barely know. Like when I see the hope in students' eyes or take care of Teddy, I feel like I'm doing something important, not just for myself but for them too. It's about making sure others aren't alone in facing tough times, just like my friends have always been there for me.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: I guess I don't always do things the most efficient way—I've faced enough obstacles and fought hard enough battles to know that sometimes, you need to take the long route to protect what matters. But that doesn't mean I'm not effective. When it comes down to it, I'll find a way to get things done, especially if it means saving my friends or making a difference. And along the way, there's always room for hope and the unexpected twists that come with it.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: In tense situations, staying completely calm isn't always possible—I mean, who can keep their nerves in check when they're facing down a dragon or a horde of Dementors? But I've learned to channel that nervous energy into doing what needs to be done. Whether it's teaching others about defense or sneaking around Hogwarts, there are times when you have to push aside the fear and focus on what's right. It's about finding the courage to face whatever comes your way, even if your heart is pounding so hard you think it might burst out of your chest.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work isn't really my thing—I've always been more drawn to challenges that require thinking outside the box and doing something new. When I visited Zonko's Joke Shop, I couldn't help but feel that there was so much more to explore and create than just the same old tricks. And honestly, dealing with the same tasks day in and day out doesn't really light a fire under me like facing something unknown and potentially dangerous does. That kind of work, where every moment can be different, that's what makes life interesting and gives me a chance to make a real difference.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: I guess you could say I’m not the most outgoing person around. Growing up with the Dursleys taught me how it feels to be on the outside looking in, and even at Hogwarts, I’ve always been more focused on the people close to me and the battles we face together than on mingling with everyone. But when it comes down to it, I’ll always step up for my friends and for what’s right, no matter what. That’s where the real magic happens, isn’t it?

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Sometimes, I can come across as rude when things get tough, especially if I feel like someone's actions or words might endanger those I care about. It's not something I do lightly, though. Usually, it's because there's so much going on, and I'm trying to protect everyone from the darkness around us. When I act like that, it's always because I believe it's necessary, even if it hurts. But at the end of the day, my friends know I wouldn't let anything bad happen to them if I could help it.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: When it comes to making plans, sometimes they work out and other times, well, things get a bit messy. It's hard to stick to a plan when there are so many unexpected twists and turns, especially when the fate of the wizarding world's at stake. But I do try to have a direction, even if it changes along the way. What really matters is being there for my friends and doing what's right, no matter the cost. That's something I always aim for.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous sometimes, especially before big Quidditch matches or facing challenges that involve protecting my friends and innocent people. It's hard not to feel scared when you know there's danger ahead, but those feelings push me to rely on my instincts and the support of my friends. We've been through so much together, and I think that bond gives me the strength to face whatever comes next.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: I guess I do spend time reflecting, but it's more about thinking about how to protect others and find ways to make things better. There's always something new to learn or a spell to master that could help in the fight against the dark forces. Seeing others grow stronger and more hopeful because of what they've learned from me, whether it's mastering the Patronus Charm or understanding the importance of teamwork in Quidditch, that gives me a lot of satisfaction. It reminds me that even the smallest actions can light up someone's path and give them the courage to keep going.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I've always been more focused on the things that matter most, like fighting against dark forces and protecting others. Truth be told, I haven't really had much time for art. But there were moments, like when I found those notes in the old Potions book, that made me realize how much beauty and creativity could be hidden in the details of magic. And then there's Hedwig, she's more than just a pet—she's a constant reminder of the care and connection that can exist beyond the battles. So maybe, in my own way, I do appreciate a bit of artistry, just not in the traditional sense.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I definitely like working with others. It's been a big part of my life, really. From facing the Triwizard Tournament to reforming the Auror Office, having friends by my side has always made all the difference. They're there for me, and I try to be there for them too. It's about believing in each other, standing strong together, no matter what challenges come our way.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Not really. When there's danger or something important happening, I tend to focus pretty well on the task at hand, no matter how chaotic things might get around me. There have been times when my friends and I were thrown into unexpected situations, like when pixies escaped in our Defense Against the Dark Arts class or during that intense chase with Death Eaters. But through it all, whether facing Voldemort or trying to teach my fellow students how to defend themselves, I've always tried to stay centered and brave. After all, distractions can be deadly when you're up against dark forces.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: I suppose I'm more of a person who finds solace in the company of my friends and the quiet moments that come between battles and adventures. Art, music, and literature aren't exactly my forte, but I do appreciate them when they give me a break from the usual chaos. A good book can transport me away from the pressures of fame and the weight of my responsibilities, even if it's just for a little while. And sometimes, a bit of music can help me remember the happier times, like those we spent at the Burrow. But in the end, I find myself drawn back to the fight against injustice and the hope of making a better world for everyone.
